nodes.bodyText: Violation for test2 is "no override", but for private and static methods violation will be different. Please add violation comments to show it for all examples above.

Doc for this property says that
This property will only check classes, interfaces, etc. that do not contain the extends or implements keyword or are not anonymous classes.
please add here comment why this is not cause violation
not be I guess it should be should not be

only checks methods overridden from java.lang.Object
It is not clear.
This is ignored because class extends other class
should not be here too

This property will only check classes, interfaces, etc. that do not contain the extends or implements keyword or are not anonymous classes.
Please add example for interface and anonymous class

Please change class/interface names in this example, they all are "Test".
Please make them different
// that is not valid I think this can be removed
// that is not valid can be removed here too
public abstract please remove these redundant modifiers, it is public and abstract by default
there is an extra space in indentation
Please fix indentation for 2 lines above - it should not be indented from previous tag, they should be on same indentation level.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -738,7 +738,32 @@ public static final int COUNTER = 10; // violation <module name="MissingOverride"/> +

Example:

+ +class Test extends SuperClass { + /** {@inheritDoc} */ + @Override + public void test1() { // OK + + } + + /** {@inheritDoc} */ + public void test2() { // violation, should be annotated with @Override + + } + + /** {@inheritDoc} */ + private void test3() { // violation, using the @inheritDoc tag on private method + + } + + /** {@inheritDoc} */ + public static void test4() { // violation, using the @inheritDoc tag on static method + + } +} +
